data.message: Congratulations, fantastic connection to the world. Knowledge is power. Can it stay up indefinitely?

replies.message: Hi Greg. Great question! When Aquila completed its first successful test flight, it flew for more than 90 minutes. Over the coming months, we're going to continue test flights. During these flights, we'll be gathering data to test and verify our models for improvement. Thanks for stopping by! -Azaria
No. Anything with moving parts break. Mictolattice and other hybrid polymers and Elements ate solving that. I like to think latent energy as a repair tactics and solar energy as refueling
Dude, Nothing can fly indefinitely. How on earth did u wonder that?
Vincent, if you can dream, it can be built. Stop being so pessimistic.
What's the name of the Company that makes these air planes ? And is the Company on the New York Stock Exchange ?
In theory you could build a solar plane to fly indefinitely, with the exception of eventually dealing with rust or other material degradation. Good job Facebook :)
This is asome thanks for connecting so many people
God Bless you for what you are do keep it up
Drone version coming soon to a region near you.😎
I was born in El Ranchito , and this is great to hear , I now live in central California , it would be cool to FaceTime around that area of Aquila , la placita and maquili and of course El ranchito .

Only takes the energy of 3 hair blowers?  I'm hoping you'll share that with the oil, electric and gas companies.  You guys must be pretty smart, because in all these years, no one (lmao) has been able to find an inexpensive fuel for anything.  You guys rock!
